page.title: 18EDUCATION IN SHIPDHAM
page.content: {Shipdham school}is very spacious. Out of school hours the Assembly Hall is used as a Community Hall. This school has a field, a playground and a hard all-weather court outside for various sports. There are about 250 children and 12 teachers not including {Mr Taylor}the Headmaster or the secretary{Mrs Doel}and our Welfare Assistant{Mrs Rix. }There are 12 classrooms. It is a first and middle, Voluntary Aided Church school and was opened in 1982 by the Bishop of Norwich. In the centre of the school there is a courtyard where, in the summer, guinea pigs and chicks are kept. Our school also has a library of about a 1000 books.Two children help with its organisation. The school has four houses which are named after famous{ local people.
